column4: Dimitar-> if you have a livecd of the newer 8.10 you can install that freshly

-> the national indonesian language is called bahasa
nice to know but the channel is #ubuntu-id
update-initramfs ? mkinitramfs ?
-> mkinitramfs
well i use it for building the initrd's of the vanilla kernels i compile... but i do not configure it specially i just do "sudo mkinitramfs -o /boot/initrd.img-kernel_version kernel_version"
where kernel_version is 2.6.29-rc7 for example
-> i got disconnected..
-> umm I forgot to mention when copying  devices into /dev/   there are no /dev/ramdisk to copy over so i wonder if thats the cause of failure..
-> perhaps i should rephrase, when you create your initrd, which /dev/ram*  do you copy over?
as i said i just run the command i do not modify its behavior in any way
i just do "sudo mkinitramfs -o /boot/initrd.img-kernel_version kernel_version"
-> oh okay, i thought you have customized it.. thanks for the response
take alook in /etc/initramfs-tools/
